intro: Selago melleri, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its strap-like leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found growing in coastal and wetland areas, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Selago melleri plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds. Its fibrous leaves have historically been used by Māori for making baskets and other woven items.
